Text.Value: Wait - the City of Judgement? How long will I stay there? And how long have I been asleep?
Indeed. His story has marched on since thy great victory - as inevitable as time itself. Let us observe.
A holding place. Somewhere safe. Thou hast slept a long while - so long I feared thou mightest never wake.
Karlach - canst thou hear me?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [DG]: Withers slowly walks towards the candles. He slowly reaches out toward the brightest one and grasps it, the flame balances it upon the tip of his finger. (LOOP)
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Withers approaches a row of flickering candles. One burns brighter than the others. He takes the flame upon his bony fingertip and speaks to it. It flickers, alive.
EditorData.NodeContext: Withers approaches a row of flickering candles. One burns brighter than the others. He takes the flame upon his bony fingertip and speaks to it. It flickers, alive.

Text.Value: I can see Shadowheart?
Where am I?
H-hello? Withers - is that you?
I can see Minthara?
I can see Gale?
I have thee now, my child. And we have much to discuss. But first - let us linger a little in the land of the living.
I can see Wyll?
But thou hast stirred just in time - thy old companions hath regathered. They will not hear thee, but thou canst bear witness.
Just long enough. Their stories have marched on, since thy great victory - as inevitable as time itself. Let us observe.
I hear you - but I don't know who or what I am.
Thou hast stirred just in time to bear witness - thy old companions have regathered.
Thou presumeth a binary that might not be, Karlach. Come - let us observe which stories have spun from thy great victory.

EditorData.stateContext: Withers holds Karlach's flame on his fingertip, speaking to it

Text.Value: Hadst  thou slept much longer, oblivion might have claimed your memories entirely. They will return to thee, Karlach - in fact, let us jog them.
Thou hast slept so long I feared thou might never wake. Dangerous, in this place beyond the Beyond.
I can see Lae'zel?
Indeed. Her story has marched on since thy great victory - as inevitable as time itself. Let us observe.
They're alive. I'm dead. Let's leave it at that.
I can see Astarion?
My companions? I can see them? How long has it been?
Great stories have thee woven - and more have sprung out of the inevitable time since thy great victory. Observe.
I can see Halsin?

Synopsis: Withers is in his chapel, approaching a row of flickering candles. This is the Avatar Karlach version of END_GameFinale_WithersGathersCompanions.
